hanzi-su-wiki:
蘭

Значения

Орхидея; Голландия

Мнемоника

Внизу ограждение ворот 門 из специально подобранных 柬 прутьев. Вьющаяся трава 艹, украшающая заборы и балконы — лиана, орхидея.

Варианты

兰

heisig_chinese_memo: The orchid thief is famous for once stealing a whole orchid tree.  Now he steals exotic flowers from the east, and takes them through airport gates.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A skillful artist can take the wool and horns from a sheep and make it look like a three branch orchid.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "艸", " Lan " sound. The original meaning is blue grass. "Said Wen": "Lan, Xiangcha also. Congcha, Lansheng." Such as "Chu Ci. "Li Sao": "Lan Zhi changed but not fragrant, Quanhui turned into grass." Wang Yi's note: "The grass of Lan Zhi changed its body without rejuvenating its fragrance." "Xunzi. "Li Lun": "The fragrant pepper orchid, so it also nourishes the nose."

"Zhou Yi. "The first part of the coherence": "The two agree, and the profit is broken. The words of the same heart, the smell is like an orchid." Kong Yingdashu: "It is said that the two people have the same heart, spit out their speech, and the smell is like a orchid." Later generations used "Jin Lan" to describe the profound friendship. Such as "Selected Works. Liu Xiaobiao's "Guangjue Jiao Lun"" "The British from the past, the friend of Jin Lan", Lu Yanji's note: "Jin Lan is a metaphor for communication. It is as strong as gold and its fragrance is like orchid." Gu Yanwu of the Qing Dynasty "Yong Ye": "At that time How many Jinlan friends have not agreed to agree at this time."

" Lan " by extension means fragrance. Such as "Confucius' Family Language. Six Books: "To live with the good people is like entering the room of Zhilan, and not smelling the fragrance for a long time, that is, it will be changed with it." "Selected Works. Zhang Maoxian's "Love Poem": "The beautiful lady is far away, and the orchid room has no light." Lu Xiang's note: "Lan, fragrant."

" Lan " also means orchid. Bluegrass and orchid belong to different families. Li Shizhen in Ming Dynasty "Compendium of Materia Medica. The third of grass. "Blue Grass": "There are several kinds of orchids, bluegrass and Eupatorium are next to the water, and mountain orchids are the ones that grow bluegrass in the mountains. Orchid also grows in the mountains, and it is far from the three orchids." An example of the ancient book is Yang Shidao in the Tang Dynasty. "Lan Cong intends to fly two butterflies, while the willow leaves are boring and wailing."

" Lan " also means Mulan. "Compendium of Materia Medica. Wood one. "Magnolia": "Magnolia has sparse branches and leaves, and its flowers are white inside and purple outside. There are also those that bloom in four seasons. Those living in deep mountains are especially large and can be a boat." Nine songs. "Mrs. Xiang": "Guidong comes to Lan Lin, Xin Yi Lin comes to the pharmacy." Zhu Xi's collection of notes: "Orchid, Mulan."

" Lan " leads to " Lan ". Such as "Warring States Policy. "Wei Ce III": "For those in another day, Qin is in Hexi, and when the Jin country goes to Liangye, there are more than a thousand miles away. The rivers and mountains are based on orchids, and there are Zhou and Han in between." Bao Biao's note: "Lan is a lan." " Lan " Indicates barrier. Another example is "Pipe. "Yin Tomoaki Note:" orchid, known as Lan Qi, soldiers stand also. "" Lan "Here, it means the army, the weapon rack.
humanum_short_description_en: From "艸", " Lan " sound. The original meaning is blue grass.
humanum_full_description:
從「艸」，「闌」聲。本義是蘭草。《說文》：「蘭，香艸也。从艸，闌聲。」如《楚辭．離騷》：「蘭芷變而不芳兮，荃蕙化而為茅。」王逸注：「言蘭芷之草，變易其體而不復香。」《荀子．禮論》：「椒蘭芬芳，所以養鼻也。」

　　《周易．繫辭上》：「二人同意，其利斷金。同心之言，其臭如蘭。」孔穎達疏：「謂二人同齊其心，吐發言語，氤氳臭氣，香馥如蘭也。」後世以「金蘭」形容深厚的交情。如《文選．劉孝標〈廣絕交論〉》「自昔把臂之英，金蘭之友」，呂延濟注：「金蘭，喻交道，其堅如金，其芳如蘭。」清代顧炎武〈永夜〉：「當時多少金蘭友，此際心期未許同。」

　　「蘭」引申表示芳香。如《孔子家語．六本》：「與善人居，如入芝蘭之室，久而不聞其香，即與之化矣」《文選．張茂先〈情詩〉》：「佳人處遐遠，蘭室無容光。」呂向注：「蘭，香也。」

　　「蘭」亦表示蘭花。蘭草和蘭花屬不同科植物，明代李時珍《本草綱目．草之三．蘭草》：「蘭有數種，蘭草、澤蘭生水旁，山蘭即蘭草之生山中者。蘭花亦生山中，與三蘭逈别。」古書的用例如唐代楊師道〈闕題〉：「蘭叢有意飛雙蝶，柳葉無趣隱啼鶯。」

　　「蘭」還表示木蘭。《本草綱目．木一．木蘭》：「木蘭枝葉俱疏，其花內白外紫，亦有四季開者，深山生者尤大，可以為舟。」如《楚辭．九歌．湘夫人》：「桂棟兮蘭橑，辛夷楣兮藥房。」朱熹集注：「蘭，木蘭也。」

　　「蘭」通「闌」。如《戰國策．魏策三》：「異日者，秦乃在河西，晉國之去梁也，千里有餘，河山以蘭之，有周、韓而間之。」鮑彪注：「蘭作闌。」「蘭」表示阻隔。又如《管子．小匡》：「制重罪入以兵甲犀脅、二戟，輕罪入蘭、盾、鞈革、二戟。」尹知章注：「蘭，即所謂蘭錡，兵架也。」「蘭」在此表示兵闌，即兵器架。

蘭字的基本解释

蘭
lán
见“兰”。

蘭字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lán］
［《廣韻》落干切，平寒，來。］
“兰1”的繁体字。
(1)兰花。多年生常绿草本植物。叶细长而尖，根簇生，圆柱形。春初开花，呈淡黄绿色，亦有秋季开花者。品种甚多，常见的有建兰、墨兰、蕙兰等。花幽香清远，可供观赏。
(2)兰草。即泽兰。多年生草本植物。叶卵形，秋季开白花。全草有香气，可制芳香油，亦可入药。
(3)引申为芳香。常用作称美之辞。参见“蘭室”、“蘭堂”、“蘭訊”。
(4)木兰。一种香木。
(5)通“闌”。兵器架。
(6)通“闌”。阻隔。
(7)通“闌”。妄。参见“蘭子”。
(8)通“欄”。
(9)通“斕”。
(10)姓。汉有武陵太守兰广。见《元和姓纂》卷四。

蘭字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　蘭； 康熙笔画：23； 页码：页1070第11
【唐韻】落干切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】郞干切，?音闌。【說文】香草也。【陸甸云】闌艸爲蘭，闌不祥也。【陸璣詩疏】其莖似藥草澤蘭，廣而長節，漢諸池苑及許昌宮中皆種之。【易·繫辭】同心之言，其臭如蘭。【左傳·宣三年】鄭文公妾燕姞，夢天與蘭，曰：蘭有國香，人服媚之。【屈原·離騷】紉秋蘭以爲佩。【爾雅翼】一榦一花而香有餘者蘭。　又【本草】木蘭。【屈原·離騷】朝搴阰之木蘭兮。　又【管子·小匡篇】輕罪入蘭盾、鞈革二戟。【註】蘭卽所謂蘭錡，兵架也。　又脈也。【史記·扁鵲傳】夫以陽入隂支蘭藏者生。【註】支者順節，蘭者橫節。隂支蘭，膽藏也。　又布名。【華陽國志】蘭干細布。蘭干，獠言紵也。　又人名。【列子·說符篇】宋有蘭子。【張堪註】凡物不知生謂之蘭。【殷敬順曰】《史記》無符傳出入謂之闌。此蘭子謂以技妄遊，義與闌同。　又姓。【通志·氏族略】漢有太守蘭廣。　又萑蘭。【前漢·息夫躬傳】涕泣流兮萑蘭。【註】萑蘭，淚闌干也。　又芄蘭。【揚子·太?經】陽氣親天，萬物芄蘭。【

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lán］
["Guangyun" is dry and cut, Ping Han, come. ]
Traditional characters for "兰1".
(1) Orchid. Perennial evergreen grass plant. The leaves are slender and pointed, and the roots are clustered and cylindrical. It blooms in early spring and is pale yellow-green, and there are also autumn bloomers. There are many varieties, the common ones are Jianlan, Molan, Cymbidium and so on. The flowers are fragrant and far-reaching for viewing.
(2) Bluegrass. That is Zelan. Perennial herb. The leaves are ovoid, with white flowers in autumn. The whole plant has a fragrance and can be used as aromatic oil or used as medicine.
(3) The extension is aromatic. Often used as a word for beauty. See "Orchid Room", "Orchid Hall", "Lanxun".
(4) Mulan. A fragrant wood.
(5) Through "Lan". Arms rack.
(6) Through "Lan". Obstruct.
(7) Through "Lan". Arrogant. See "Lanzi".
(8) Through "column".
(9) Link "Lan".
(10) Last name. In the Han Dynasty, there was Languang, the prefect of Wuling. See "Yuanhe Surname Compilation" Volume Four.
